paragraphs: No, this is not a decoration from a science fiction movie, but a real existing technical oddity. It is located in the building of the Czech Social Security Administration (ČSSZ) in the Smíchov district (Křížová 2383/27, Prague 5).

The card catalog was built in 1936-1937 according to the project of architects František Albert Libra and Jiří Kana. It was used until 2002 when, as a result of digitization, the need for a unique device finally disappeared.
The card index continues to be maintained in working condition. Since 2004, it has been designated as a protected cultural monument.
The length of the wall is 52 meters, the width is 6 meters, and the height is 8 meters. It is serviced by eighteen mobile working platforms.
The card index contains 9000 boxes (each 3 meters long) and accommodates a total of 135 million documents related to pensions and social benefits for residents.
📌 The object is rarely shown to the general public. The next opportunity to see it with your own eyes will be on October 2 as part of the "Architecture Day 2025" festival.
🕛 Guided tours will take place every 15 minutes from 12:00 to 16:00. Group size - 10 people. Duration - 20 minutes. Only adults are allowed.
❗️ Participation is free, but pre-registration is required. It will open this Sunday, September 14, at this link.
Last year, the spots were taken very quickly, and registration started at night.
